alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 01 at 1:53AM CDT until April 01 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM CDT FOR CHICKASAW...SOUTHERN CALHOUN AND NORTHWESTERN MONROE COUNTIES... At 153 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Pyland, or near Houston, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Tornado, quarter size hail, and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Aberdeen, Houston, Okolona, Bruce, Calhoun City, Vardaman, Derma, Pittsboro, Slate Springs, Prairie, Sabougla, Pyland, New Wren, Trebloc, Nettleton, Big Creek, Woodland, Thorn, Egypt and Loyd. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
